reviews.review_msg: The syllabus says the average WILL be a B/B+ turns out to be a B-, I emailed her about this and said that "low outliers" explained the average being a B-. Don't promise something in a syllabus if it isn't true. The average for the final was low 60s. All the lectures is her umming and uhhing reading off the slides, yet participation is required

Her class is long and boring since she just read her slides directly for three hours. Be ready to read a lot of readings and watch many videos she only asks for one or two of those in her exam. Midterm is harder than the final exam and doing well in those papers is the key way to be successful in this class since it counts >30% of the course

Very uninspired, reads unoriginal and reused lecture slides for 3 hours straight. I understand policy is dry in itself, but there is little attempt to sound lively. Way too many weekly readings and videos.

LOTS of readings and videos to watch. exams are based on all of the required readings and videos plus the weekly lecture slides which is a lot of content to cover. select all that apply mcs made exam harder that it is. not the worst but wouldn't take her again.

She gives a lot of readings but is clear which sections are important for exams. She is very helpful and accessible as well as understanding about assignment difficulties if you contacted her. Her exams are fair as long as you do the readings. It was also open book which helped. Multiple choices are tough due select all that apply.

Lauren Currie was an incredibly lazy professor, reading directly from slides that were obviously reused semester after semester. Classes were online, and absolutely no attempt was made to try to engage the class. She had an expectation for students to work for 14 hours a week outside of lectures on this class. She IS as bad as students here claim.

Professor Currie's voice was very monotone and boring. The examinations went well, but they were rushed. The books and homework were many despite the course's interest. She expected to watch many videos and read articles before each session. Also, she didn't respond to emails.

Dr. Currie isn't as bad as she's been made out to be. She explains ideas well and goes through lectures at a fair speed. There's alot of assigned readings/videos but if you have a light course load then this should be doable. Course content is boring but that's not her fault, this course' dedicated to the Canadian health system which isn't riveting

if you want a prof who never answers emails and doesnt care about her students, this is the prof for you. LOTS of readings and long videos every week, long lectures, but the assignments were manageable. Very inaccessible and unorganized. Other than that, class was okay, content was uninteresting

Laurens not as bad as others make her out to be but there are a LOT of readings and long vids every week. Takes forever to post the recorded lectures, making it hard to stay caught up if u have to miss a class. The midterm was fair if you read and studied. Long paper (10 pages), weekly participation, and long lectures. TA's are super nice n helpful

Professor Currie was ok, but lectures were super heavy and having them be via zoom was not optimal because she goes so fast through them you barely have time to keep up, and the way she speaks is very monotone and uninteresting. The exams were ok but very rushed for time. The course was interesting but the readings and assignments were abundant.

Requires an insane amount of reading considering there are other courses being taken just not necessary, overall the worst teacher I've had in college. Reads off slides, there's nothing to grab my attention in between all the "uh's" she does every 2nd line.

Poorly conducted class. Tasks are immense (weekly book chapters + articles, lectures + extra asynchronous material), & lectures were extremely dry/tedious. Assignment expectations were somewhat clear, but final exam was quite literally impossible given time constraints, did not match study guide, and was a poor demonstration of our learning. 2/10

Just... yikes. This experience was one of the driest and most unenjoyable experiences imaginable. Dr. Currie was not a bad person at all but the course was so poorly designed. Confusing rubrics for assignments mixed with horrid marking scaling students down, and a final exam that was so brutal - 50 Qs in 60 mins? Wouldn't recommend in ANY SITUATION
She is not a bad professor, just gives a lot of readings. She is very helpful and easily accessible. Her exams are super fair and easy as long as you do the readings!

Lot of required readings in this class, but they are super helpful for further understanding the lecture material. Although her slides are very text heavy, she does a good job going through them. Exams were fair, but was not a fan of her multiple choice, which were select all that apply. Overall, Lauren is very nice prof, would recommend.

Course content can be dry at times and there's A LOT. However, if you keep up, study, and do practice questions you'll do okay. Also having an interest in this topic definitely makes the class easier.

exams are unreasonable, select-all-that-apply for multiple choice exams without partial marks. 3 papers, a midterm, and a final! not to mention the amount of papers and videos you are supposed to read/watch each week (at least 30 hours a week). she literally reads from the slides and sounds so unimpressed. her fav word is um so get ready to hear it

avoid her at all costs. 30 hours of required readings each week that go far too in-depth for what she teaches. abysmal lectures that lack critical information needed for exams. says um 50 times per minute. difficult midterm and final. 3 large papers. an overall horrible professor that shows no sympathy for her students.
Probably the most boring lecturer Ive met throughout my entire degree. Doesnt even pretend to try and enjoy any of the content.

The reading is too much, the tests are open book but so long. She literally reads off the slides word by word... if I wanted an audio book about the health care system, I wouldve bought one instead. From the famous words of tiktok youre done. Youre done.

Dry 3 hour lectures, says "um" a lot, unfair standards for exams where she has "select all that apply" multiple choice questions with no partial marks (it's either you get the point for picking the correct choices or receive a 0 for picking one less/more correct option). Note taking is also impossible because she zooms through text-heavy slides.

The content of the class is actually really interesting (it was more entertaining reading the textbook) somehow she managed to make it super boring. No discussion or engagement at all she really doesn't know how to encourage students to talk. Also kinda intimidating. If it wasn't for the class participation mark I think her lectures would be empty.

Dr. Currie is a hard grader and her TAs won't mark your work right unless it's exactly what was written on the answer sheet. This prof is strict but her tests are pretty straightforward as long as you memorize all the notes. Remember to memorize the notes!!!!!

Lauren is not really my favourite professor. She likes you if you participate though. She generally just reads off the slides so you could skip class you just might miss some in class participation assignments. Get ready to memorize the entire book because the first midterm was 9 chapters.....

boring class but Lauren had decent slides and fair tests. Lots of writing but that is the format from the prof who created the course not Lauren. Tophat really sucked cos half the time she asked only one question when class started. She tested a little bit from readings but you could survive without them. I felt she was willing to help when I asked

Lauren is not a bad professor, however she is just really boring as she reads off her slides.  I didn't enjoy her class because she made boring for me, made me lose interest in it. I didn't like her attitude...  So I ended up dropping the course, BEST DECISION EVER.

Currie is definitely by far one of the worst professor's I've ever encountered. She is currently teaching Hsci1120 at Langara College and I can honestly say I'm glad I dropped out. Attending lectures are not mandatory as she only reads directly from her slides. She doesn't know the answers to the questions that students' ask most of the time.

Really boring lecturer. With 2 papers, a midterm, homework assignments, and a final exam it was a very heavy course load. Her exams consisted of memorizing the lecture notes and textbook readings. Her voice will make you want to fall asleep in lectures, but make sure you attend as the participation was worth a lot in the end and makes a difference.

The class itself wasn't difficult but her grading criteria and style is inexplicable. You won't know what you're being marked on until you get your paper back with nit picky comments docking entire marks. First homework assignment of four questions (Wanted definition of terms) was out of 95 marks inexplicably. Would not recommend at all.

Lauren Currie is easily one of the worst professors at SFU. She is rude and truly believes she is superior to those around her. Absolutely NO constructive feedback from her or her AWFUL teaching assistants. The marking is SUPER subjective, regardless if it the huge/irrelevant paper we have to write, or the assignments. Just Awful.

TAs in this course can make or break. Be very careful which one you get! Saw the same TA regularly lower students marks if they  asked questions about their assignments, or even just for an explanation of what they missed. Even showed the class on the projector her lowering a students mark infront of everyone! Lauren herself is a meh lecturer.

I took her class last year fall.. Grading criteria unclear and basically depends on who marked ur exam or paper meaning someone could get a question wrong while you got the same answer right & if you ask about why you got deducted grades or a remarking you'll get deducted even more i.e go from 80% to 70%. 8:30 iclicker no grade if you come at 8:35.

If you hand in your assignment one minute pass the deadline it will be marked late and you will be deducted 10-20%. Hand in all your assignments on time and get to class before 8:30. MC questions on exams are tricky, make sure to read the textbook thoroughly, no need to read slides. You don't need to go to lectures other than for pop quizzes.

A prof makes or breaks your over all experience in a class and how well you do in the course. Lauren is not available for extra help, nor are her TAs. TOPHAT is mandatory to purchase in order to participate in class but she used it for 5 questions total in the course and the rest were pop quizzes in class at 8:30am.

In all my years at SFU, Lauren is probably the worst prof I've had. Lectures at 830am are pointless because she literally reads right off the slides in a monotone voice and the exact same info is in the textbook. Makes attendance mandatory by using tophat but stopped using it halfway .Waste of money. Not very friendly and not very accommodating.

I took HSCI 307 in Spring 2016. It was a good class. I didn't attend many lectures due to them being at 8:30, so my clicker mark suffered but it didn't really affect my grade. The midterms/final were fair, she tells you what to focus on in lectures. The research paper mark is dependent on TA, overall for a 300 level course it was manageable.

Hardly any clarification or grading rubric for an incredibly long paper. She seems like a nice person and replies quickly, but makes a pretty bad prof. She's also very monotone and having an 8:30 lecture made it difficult to pay attention. The grading is unclear and feedback is minimal, but that might have more to do with the TA.
